title: Border, ca. 1790
provenance: Found at Barclay's Bank, 7 Manor Street, Bridlington, the former residence of Sir Henry Boynton who in 1825 converted two houses, built about 1790, into one. Reverse of "b" has adhering under-layer of wallpaper on the back of which is portion of a tax stamp. (This paper was applied before remodelling.)
description: a,b) Incomplete repeat showing pink roses with green leaves and part of a vase form; c) white flowery forms (part of the above paper) with grisaille and brown flock border attached;d,e) grisaille and brown flock border like one in "c".

tombstone.epitaph:
Border, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Block-printed on handmade paper. Gift of E.A. Entwisle. 1953-188-1-a/e.
